alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Knox (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 3:32PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Anderson and north central Knox Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 432 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Clinton, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Knoxville, Oak Ridge, Clinton, Halls, Rocky Top, Norris, Andersonville, Powell and Karns. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
